explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_solids.rationale: No data available by regulated examination methods, though "Flammable" (ICSC (J) (1997))

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Although there is the information that water is contacted and inflammable gas is produced (ICSC (J) (1997)), no data based on a set test method.

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Containing no oxygen , chlorine and fluorine.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Considering the description of "Rat LD50 value=>4000mg/kg (EHC 78 (1988))", and that 1 rat among 10 rats died from the 17000mg/kg medication (ACGIH (7th, 2001) and DFGOT (vol.18, 2002)), the value was regarded out of category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Category 2 because of "SPECIES: Rat; ENDPOINT: LC50(4hr.); VALUE: 0.4mg/L"(HSDB, 2006)

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: From description that dermatitis is caused to part humans (ACGIH (7th, 2001), DFGOT (vol.18, 2002)), it was judged that there was skin irritation and, it was set as Category 2.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description that in the test applied to the eye of the rabbit, mild irritation was acknowledged (HSDB (2006)), it was set as Category 2B.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Classification not possible
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory organ: No data. Skin : It is judged as negative based on the description in HSDB (2006) that positive rates were 5% in the skin sensitivity test which used the guinea pigs, however, there was description that sensitization of the skin may be expressed as influence to the human (though no case reports were made) in HSDB (2006), ICSC (J), (1997), HSFS (1999), and SITTIG (4th, 2002), therefore we presupposed that we could not classify it because of the insufficiency of the data .

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

carcinogenicity.rationale: Since it is classified into a group 3 (7 IARC Suppl. 1987) in IARC and A4 (ACGIH 7th, 2001) in ACGIH, it was considered as the outside of Category.

toxic_to_reproduction.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the undorn child
toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 based on the description that it is observed malformation of offspring at dose causing general toxicity to maternal animal in pregnant rat oral administration test (EHC 78 (1988) and the DFGOT (vol.18, 2002)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause respiratory irritation or may cause drowsiness and dizziness (respiratory tract irritation, narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: From description in ACGIH (7th, 2001) and DFGOT (vol.18, 2002) that respiratory irritant is seen in humans, and description in HSDB (2006) that central nervous system depressions was seen in the single oral administrations to rats, it was thought that there were respiratory irritant and an anesthesia action. So it was set as Category 3 (respiratory irritant, anesthesia action).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (thyroid gland, nervous system) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the description that the effects on the nervous systems were observed with the dosage a little exceeded the Category 2 guidance value range in the two-years oral study using the rat, and with the dosage in the Category 2 guidance value range in the oral study for one year using the dog (EHC 78 (1988)), and the description that in the 80-weeks feeding oral administration tests using the rat, the effects on the thyroid and nervous systems were observed with the dosage in the Category 2 guidance value range (DFGOT (vol.18, 2002)), it was classified into Category 2 (thyroid, nervous systems).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48-hour LC50=0.09mg/L of Crustacea (Daphnia magna), and others (EHC78, 1988).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity was Category 1, supposed not rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), though supposed less bioaccumulative (log Kow=-1.6(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).
